q: 1. What is the focus of the news report regarding university departments?
2. What is the main issue being discussed about the school's budget?
3. Who is the person mentioned in the news story?
4. Why was the man's action considered controversial?
options: He locked up the young homeless boy
He thought he was doing a good deed
He let the young boy sneak in through the window
He told the Dean of York College of what he had done

q: 5. What did the woman do before she moved to Chicago?
options: She served as the Associate Dean of Harper University
She went to High School in Chicago

q: 6. Which of the following is true about her academic background?
options: She was 17 when she attended Pasadena University
She earned her master's and Ph.D at Western State University
She held teaching positions at only one college

q: 7. How many different universities has she been affiliated with throughout her career?
8. What are the speakers mainly discussing about their past education?
9. According to the man, what was the greatest benefit of his education?
options: The chance to sharpen his experience
The chance to sharpen his knowledge
The chance to sharpen his skills
The chance to sharpen his grades

q: 10. What does the man say about his current ability?
options: He's able to understand old style of English better
He's able to understand William Shakespeare better
He's able to write literature better

q: 11. Which famous author did the woman mention in the conversation?
12. How much is the average annual tuition mentioned in the dialogue?
13. Why is the man hesitating about his future career path?
options: Because he feels that being a doctor is too stressful
Because he feels that university fees are too expensive
Because he feels that Yale or Harvard universities aren't good enough
Because he feels that medical school is too difficult

q: 14. What does the figure $9,650 represent in the context of the talk?
options: The cost of a one-year program for out-of-state college
The cost of a one-year program in a public college
The cost of a one-year program in a private college
The total debt of a four-year program

q: 15. According to the woman, what is the most important thing for success?
16. What is the main subject of Passage One?
17. What is a common motivation for a bully according to the speaker?
options: The bully is bored and has to pick on someone
The bully wants to be in control
The bully has left the people he once bullied and his behaviour continues
The bull is being bullied by other students

q: 18. How does the passage define 'Hazing'?
options: The practice of initiating a person into a group

q: 19. What is the central theme of Passage Two?
options: Applying to travel to the U.S.
Applying to teach in the U.S.

q: 20. What is the first thing a student should check in the application process?
21. What must international students provide to prove their academic level?
22. Who is the speaker's graduation speech primarily addressed to?
23. What does the speaker say she will remember most about her college life?
24. How did the speaker feel when she first arrived at the university?
25. What sentiment does the speaker express at the end of her speech?
options: She implies that she has no home to go to
She implies that she will miss them all
She implies that she doesn't know what to do
She implies that she has no friends
